title: Prekindergarten Mathematics
teaser: Students explore two and three-dimensional shapes, compare length, weight, and capacity, addition and subtraction stories, and counting to 20.

children.title: Counting To 5
children.teaser: Students are exposed to sustained interaction to the number core.

children.title: Matching Objects
children.teaser: Children learn to match concrete objects with common attributes.

children.title: Match 2 Objects That Are Exactly The Same
children.teaser: Students categorize and match objects.

children.title: Match 2 Objects That Are The Same, But….
children.teaser: Children expand their understanding ofmatching.

children.title: Match 2 Objects That Are The Same, But…. (Continued)
children.teaser: Students match images that are the same, but…

children.title: Match 2 Objects That Are Used Together
children.teaser: Students extend their understanding of matching to include items that are used together.

children.title: Sorting
children.teaser: Children sort objects into groups using given attributes.

children.title: Make One Group With A Given Attribute.
children.teaser: Students form groups of objects based on attributes.

children.title: Sort Into Two Groups.
children.teaser: Students advance to making two groups rather than just one.

children.title: Sort The Same Group Of Objects In Two Different Ways.
children.teaser: Students sort the same set ofobjects in two different ways.

children.title: How Many Questions With 1, 2, Or 3 Objects
children.teaser: Students learn to answer how many questions with objects in varying configurations.

children.title: Count Up To 3 Objects.
children.teaser: Children count to 3 and answer how many questions about “Goldilocks and the Three Bears.”

children.title: Arrange And Count Up To 3 Objects In Scattered And Linear Configurations. (Continued)
children.teaser: Students count up to 3 objects in different configurations.

children.title: Arrange And Count Up To 3 Objects In Scattered And Linear Configurations.
children.teaser: Students practice counting pictured objects in scattered and linear configurations.

children.title: Arrange And Count Up To 3 Objects To Play A Game.
children.teaser: Students arrange and count up to 3 objects in a game.

children.title: Match 1 Numeral With Up To 3 Objects
children.teaser: Students answer how many questions for groups of up to 3

children.title: Match The Numerals 1, 2, And 3 To Quantities.
children.teaser: Children match a group of objects to a given numeral.

children.title: Make A Group Of Up To 3 Objects And Match The Numeral.
children.teaser: Students make a group of up to 3 objects and match the numeral (concrete to abstract).

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Objects To Match (Abstract To Concrete)
children.teaser: Students count a group of sticks to match different representations of the numbers 1, 2, and 3.

children.title: How Many Questions With 4 Or 5 Objects
children.teaser: Children move on to groups of as many as 5 objects and answer how many questions in the context of play.

children.title: Arrange And Count Up To 5 Objects In Scattered And Linear Configurations.
children.teaser: Children extend their ability to count up to 5 objects in both scattered and linearconfigurations.

children.title: Arrange And Count Up To 5 Objects In Scattered And Linear Configurations (Continued)
children.teaser: Students count how many family members are shown in photos.

children.title: Count Fingers On The Left Hand From 1 To 5.
children.teaser: Students tap and count to 4 and 5 on their left hand from pinky to thumb using a piano template.

children.title: Arrange And Count 4 Objects In An Array Configuration.
children.teaser: Students count 4 and 5 objects arranged in an array configuration.

children.title: Find Embedded Numbers Within 4 And 5 Objects.
children.teaser: Students find pairs of embeddednumbers within groups of 4 and 5 objects.

children.title: Arrange And Count 5 Objects In A Circular Configuration.
children.teaser: Students learn strategies to count a group of 5 objects in a circular configuration.

children.title: Match 1 Numeral With Up To 5 Objects
children.teaser: Children match numerals with up to 5 objects.

children.title: Count Up To 4 Objects And Match The Numerals.
children.teaser: Students match a group of 4 objects to the numeral that tells how many.

children.title: Count Up To 5 Objects And Match The Numerals.
children.teaser: Students match a group of 5 objects to the numeral that tells how many.

children.title: Make A Group Of Up To 5 Objects And Match The Numeral.
children.teaser: Students create two different groups to match the number of dots shown on a rolled die.

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Objects To Match.
children.teaser: Students create a group after seeing a numeral or hearing a number.

children.title: Represent Numbers 1–5 Using Objects, Pictures, And Numerals.
children.teaser: Students represent numbers 1–5.

children.title: Represent Numbers 1–5 Using Objects, Pictures, And Numerals (Continued)
children.teaser: Children make choices about how to represent the numbers.

children.title: Play A Game Involving Numbers To 5.
children.teaser: Students synthesize their understanding of the quantities 1–5 by playing a bingo game.

children.title: One More With Numbers 1 To 5
children.teaser: Students count one more with numbers 1 to 5.

children.title: Count 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 With Stories.
children.teaser: Children count 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, to show a number of snakes slithering through sand.

children.title: Find 1 More.
children.teaser: Students toss beanbags into hula hoops to match a numeral from 1 to 5.

children.title: Build A Tower By Putting 1 More Cube Or Block At A Time.
children.teaser: Children use linking cubes to build number towers.

children.title: Build Number Stairs Showing 1 More With Cubes.
children.teaser: Children build separate number towers for each number 1–5, which they assemble into a set of number stairs.

children.title: Count Up: What Comes After?
children.teaser: Students ask and answer counting questions.

children.title: Counting 5, 4, 3, 2, 1
children.teaser: Students count one less with numbers 1 to 5.

children.title: Build Descending Number Stairs At The Concrete And Pictorial Levels.
children.teaser: Students make step-down number stairs.

children.title: Build Descending Number Stairs At The Concrete And Pictorial Levels (Continued)
children.teaser: Students make step-down number stairs to show one less.

children.title: Count 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 Using A Story.
children.teaser: Students count 5, 4, 3, 2, 1.

children.title: Count 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 Using A Story. (Continued)
children.teaser: Students count 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 using a story

children.title: Sort Objects By Use And Count Each Group.
children.teaser: Students sort objects by use and count each group.

children.title: Shapes
children.teaser: Students practice counting skills in the context of geometry.

children.title: Two-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Children identify, analyze, sort, compare, and position two-dimensional shapes.

children.title: Find And Describe Circles, Rectangles, Squares, And Triangles Using Informal Language Without Naming.
children.teaser: Students find and describe circles, rectangles, squares, and triangles using informal language without naming.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Position Triangles.
children.teaser: Children identify, sort, describe, and analyze triangles.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Position Rectangles And Squares.
children.teaser: Children identify, sort, describe, and analyze rectangles and squares.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Position Circles.
children.teaser: Children sort a collection of circles and other shapes, including ovals as non-circles.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Position Circles, Rectangles, Squares, And Triangles.
children.teaser: Children observe, identify, analyze, sort, compare, and position shapes.

children.title: Constructing Two-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Students think about the parts of shapes and relate those parts to the whole.

children.title: Construct A Triangle.
children.teaser: Students construct a triangle from their component parts.

children.title: Construct A Rectangle And A Square.
children.teaser: Students construct rectangles and squares from their component parts.

children.title: Construct A Circle.
children.teaser: Students build a circle, using equal-length craft sticks and linking cubes.

children.title: Three-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Children identify, analyze, sort, compare, and position three-dimensional (3-D) shapes.

children.title: Find And Describe Solid Shapes Using Informal Language Without Naming.
children.teaser: Children describe characteristics of solid shapes without naming them.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Match Solid Shapes To Their Two-Dimensional Faces.
children.teaser: Students consider and compare the parts ofthree-dimensional shapes.

children.title: Identify, Analyze, Sort, Compare, And Build With Solid Shapes.
children.teaser: students  examine and describe the functionality of different solid shapes in order to build with them (e.g., blocks).

children.title: Position Solid Shapes To Create A Model Of A Familiar Place.
children.teaser: Students synthesize their understanding of position words and the structure of three-dimensional shapes to construct a simple model.

children.title: Counting To 10
children.teaser: Children count groups of 0, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 objects.

children.title: How Many Questions With Up To 7 Objects
children.teaser: Children answer how many questions with up to 7 objects.

children.title: Introduce 6 And 7, And How They Relate To 5 And 6 And 1 More.
children.teaser: Children are introduced to 6 and 7 in the context of a soccer team looking for more players.

children.title: Use Linear Configurations To Count 6 And 7 In Relation To 5.
children.teaser: Students further explore 6 and 7 in relationship to 5.

children.title: Count To 6 And 7 Left To Right With Fingers.
children.teaser: Children count to 6 and 7.

children.title: Count To 6 And 7 Left To Right With Fingers. (Continued)
children.teaser: Children count to 6 and 7 left to right with fingers.

children.title: Count 6 Objects In Array Configurations.
children.teaser: Children are introduced to arrays in the context of sorting laundry.

children.title: Matching One Numeral With Up To 7 Objects
children.teaser: Children match groups of 6 and 7 objects to the pre-written numeral that tells how many.

children.title: Compose 6, And Then Decompose Into Two Parts. Match To The Numeral 6.
children.teaser: Students are introduced to numerals 6 along with embedded numbers.

children.title: Compose 7, And Then Decompose Into Two Parts. Match To The Numeral 7.
children.teaser: Students are introduced to numerals 7 along with embedded numbers.

children.title: Count 6 And 7 Objects In Circular Configurations.
children.teaser: Children count groups of 6 and 7 in circular configurations.

children.title: Arrange And Count 6 And 7 Objects In Varied Configurations.
children.teaser: Children practice counting a group of fish in varied configurations.

children.title: Tally 6 And 7 Objects.
children.teaser: Children make tally marks to represent quantities to 7.

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Up To 7 Objects.
children.teaser: Children make a group of up to 7 fish after seeing or hearing a number.

children.title: How Many Questions With Up To 8 Objects
children.teaser: Children incorporate the challenging number 8 into their understanding of the number core.

children.title: Introduce 8, And Relate 8 To 7 And 1 More.
children.teaser: Children touch and count 7 octopustentacles, then discover 1 more.

children.title: Use Linear Configurations To Count 8 In Relation To 5
children.teaser: Students explore 8 in relationship to 5 and asks children to count to 8 in linear configurations.

children.title: Count To 8 From Left To Right On The Fingers.
children.teaser: Children count to 8 using their fingers.

children.title: Count 8 Objects In Array Configurations.
children.teaser: Children work with arrays to count up to 8 objects.

children.title: Matching One Numeral With Up To 8 Objects
children.teaser: Students match a group of up to 8 objects to the numeral that tells how many.

children.title: Compose 8, And Decompose Into Two Parts. Match To The Numeral 8.
children.teaser: Students introduce the numeral 8 as children practice decomposing and composing 8.

children.title: Count 8 Objects In Circular Configurations.
children.teaser: Children count up to 8 objects arranged in a circular configuration.

children.title: Arrange And Count 8 Objects In Varied Configurations.
children.teaser: Students arrange up to 8 seeds in varied configurations and then choose the matching numeral.

children.title: Tally 8 Objects.
children.teaser: Students match tallies to the number 8.

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Up To 8 Objects.
children.teaser: Children make a bouquet of up to 8 flowers after seeing a numeral.

children.title: How Many Questions With 0 Up To 9 Objects
children.teaser: Children continue counting and answering how many questions with numbers to 9.

children.title: Introduce Zero.
children.teaser: Children learn to describe 0.

children.title: Introduce 9, And Relate 9 To 8 And 1 More.
children.teaser: Students count out 8 grapes, and add 1 more.

children.title: Use Linear Configurations To Count 9 In Relation To 5.
children.teaser: Students explore 9 in relation to 5.

children.title: Count From 0 To 9 From Left To Right On The Fingers.
children.teaser: Children count from 0 to 9.

children.title: Count 9 Objects In Array Configurations.
children.teaser: Children work with arrays, counting storybook characters in groups of 3.

children.title: Matching One Numeral With Up To 9 Objects
children.teaser: Children match groups of 0 and 9 objects.

children.title: Compose And Decompose 9. Match Numerals 0 And 9 To No And 9 Objects.
children.teaser: Students are introduced to the numerals 0 and 9.

children.title: Count 9 Objects In Circular Configurations.
children.teaser: Children count up to 9 objects arranged in a circular configuration.

children.title: Arrange And Count 9 Objects In Varied Configurations.
children.teaser: Students arrange up to 9 seeds in varied configurations and to find the matching numeral.

children.title: Tally 9 Objects.
children.teaser: Students tally up to 9 objects.

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Up To 9 Objects.
children.teaser: Students count out 9 objects based on a given numeral.

children.title: How Many Questions With Up To 10 Objects
children.teaser: Children answer how many questions with up to 10 objects.

children.title: Introduce 10, And Relate 10 To 9 And 1 More.
children.teaser: Students counting out 9 objects, then they get 1 more and touch and count 10 objects.

children.title: Use Linear Configurations To Count 10 In Relation To 5.
children.teaser: Students practice counting 10 objects in relation to 5.

children.title: Count From 0 To 10 From Left To Right On The Fingers.
children.teaser: Students count from 0 to 10 using their fingers.

children.title: Count 10 Objects In Array Configurations.
children.teaser: Children work with arrays in the context of sorting laundry.

children.title: Matching One Numeral With Up To 10 Objects
children.teaser: Children match groups of up to 10 objects.

children.title: Compose 10, And Decompose Into Two Parts. Match To The Numeral 10.
children.teaser: Students are introduced to the numeral 10 as children practice decomposing and composing 10.

children.title: Decompose Numbers 6–10.
children.teaser: Children explore the idea that a number (6–10) can be decomposed in different ways.

children.title: Arrange And Count 10 Objects In Circular Configurations.
children.teaser: Children count groups of 10 objects in circular configurations and match the numeral that tells how many.

children.title: Count Up To 10 Objects In Varied Configurations.
children.teaser: Children arrange and count up to 10 objects.

children.title: Count Up To 10 Objects In Varied Configurations. (Continued)
children.teaser: Children count and match up to 10 objects in varied configurations.

children.title: Tally 10 Objects.
children.teaser: Children tally up to 10 objects.

children.title: Look At A Numeral And Count Out A Group Of Up To 10 Objects.
children.teaser: Children practice counting out a group of up to 10 objects when given a numeral.

children.title: Represent Numbers 6–10 Using Objects, Images, And Numerals In A Number Book.
children.teaser: Children represent numbers 6–10 in a variety of ways.

children.title: Comparison Of Length, Weight, Capacity, And Numbers To 5
children.teaser: Children identify and compare measurable attributes of objects.

children.title: Comparison Of Length
children.teaser: Students describe and compare measureable attributes.

children.title: Identify The Attribute Of Length By Describing Objects As Tall Or Short.
children.teaser: Students refine their descriptions of objects.

children.title: Compare Length Using Taller Than And Shorter Than.
children.teaser: Children understand the importance of aligning endpoints when measuring.

children.title: Compare Length Using Longer Than, Shorter Than, And The Same As.
children.teaser: Children comparing and measure objects by aligning endpoints.

children.title: Compare Length Using Longer Than, Shorter Than, And The Same As. (Continued)
children.teaser: Students compare length with linking cube trains and towers.

children.title: Compare Length Using About The Same As.
children.teaser: Students match objects with similar lengths.

children.title: Comparison Of Weight
children.teaser: Children use more precise language to compare weight.

children.title: Identify The Attribute Of Weight By Describing Objects As Heavy Or Light.
children.teaser: Students choose an object and describe it as heavy or light.

children.title: Compare Weight Using Heavier Than, Lighter Than, And About The Same As.
children.teaser: Students  use new vocabulary to compare weights.

children.title: Compare Weight Using Heavier Than, Lighter Than, And The Same As With Balance Scales.
children.teaser: Students compare weights of objects using balance scales.

children.title: Comparison Of Volume
children.teaser: Students learn the concept of volume and the vocabulary used to describe and compare it.

children.title: Identify The Attribute Of Volume By Describing Containers As Big Or Small.
children.teaser: Students pack various grocery items in both big and small grocery bags to compare volume.

children.title: Compare Volume Using More Than Or Less Than.
children.teaser: Students compare the capacity of different-sized containers.

children.title: Compare Volume Using The Same As With Sand And Explore Conservation.
children.teaser: Students investigate the concept of conservation and the same as in the context of volume.

children.title: Find Objects That Match Given Length, Weight, And Volume Comparison Statements.
children.teaser: Students find objects that match given comparison statements.

children.title: First And Last
children.teaser: Students count objects in a scattered configuration while identifying the first and last object counted.

children.title: Identify First And Last In A Scattered Configuration With 2–5 Objects.
children.teaser: Students mark the first and last object counted in a scattered configuration.

children.title: Identify First And Last In A Linear Configuration With 2–10 Objects.
children.teaser: Students identify first and last with up to 10 objects.

children.title: Identify First And Last In A Circular Configuration With 2–10 Objects.
children.teaser: Students see the importance of marking the first and last object as they count as many as ten objects in a circular configuration.

children.title: Are There Enough?
children.teaser: Students count and compare objects to determine if there are enough.

children.title: Compare: Match To Find There Are Not Enough.
children.teaser: Students play musical chairs to learn the concept of "not enough."

children.title: Compare: Match To Find There Are Exactly Enough.
children.teaser: Students match objects to learn the concept of "exactly enough."

children.title: Compare: Match To Find That There Are Enough, With Some Extras.
children.teaser: Students match objects to learn the concept of "some extra."

children.title: Comparison Of Sets Up To 5
children.teaser: Students compare sets of up to 5 objects.

children.title: Count And Match To Compare Using Fewer Than Statements.
children.teaser: Students compare using fewer than statements.

children.title: Count And Match To Compare Using The Same As Statements.
children.teaser: Students compare using the same as statements.

children.title: Count And Match To Compare Using More Than Statements.
children.teaser: Students compare using more than statements.

children.title: Count And Match To Make Sets.
children.teaser: Students construct a building that has the same number of blocks as a pre-constructed building.

children.title: Comparison Of Sets Including Numerals Up To 5
children.teaser: Students compare quantities using numerals by using the counting and matching strategies.

children.title: Compare Numbers Using Greater Than And Equal To Statements.
children.teaser: Students count and compare objects using "greater than" or "equal to."

children.title: Compare A Number Of Objects Using Less Than Or The Same As Statements.
children.teaser: Students count and compare objects using "less than" or "same as."

children.title: Compare Numbers Using Less Than And Equal To Statements.
children.teaser: Students count and compare objects using "less than" or "equal to."

children.title: Count And Match To Compare Two Sets Of Linking Cube Towers.
children.teaser: Students play a game involving counting, matching, comparing, and building.

children.title: Compare A Number Of Objects Using More Than Or The Same As Statements.
children.teaser: Students count and compare objects using "more than" or "same as."

children.title: Addition And Subtraction Stories And Counting To 20
children.teaser: Children transition to the concepts of addition and subtraction and begin work with operations.

children.title: Writing Numerals 0 To 5
children.teaser: Children begin to write numerals 0–5.

children.title: Write Numerals 0 And 1.
children.teaser: Students begin writing the numerals 0 and 1.

children.title: Write Numeral 2.
children.teaser: Students begin writing the numeral 2.

children.title: Write Numeral 3.
children.teaser: Students begin writing the numeral 3.

children.title: Write Numeral 4.
children.teaser: Students begin writing the numeral 4.

children.title: Write Numeral 5.
children.teaser: Students begin writing the numeral 5.

children.title: Contextualizing Addition Stories To Solve
children.teaser: Students begin exploring the addition of numbers to 5 through story problems.

children.title: Act Out Add To With Result Unknown Story Problems To Solve.
children.teaser: Students act out add to with result unknown stories.

children.title: Solve Add To With Result Unknown Story Problems Using Objects From The Story.
children.teaser: Children begin using objects to solve addition stories.

children.title: Represent Add To With Result Unknown Story Problems Using Number Sentences.
children.teaser: Students make a statement and learning to say a number sentence.

children.title: Solve Put Together With Total Unknown Story Problems With Objects From The Story And Drawings.
children.teaser: Students work with put together with total unknown story problems.

children.title: Create And Solve Addition Story Problems Using Drawings.
children.teaser: Students create their own addition stories.

children.title: Contextualizing Subtraction Stories To Solve
children.teaser: Children shift focus to subtraction stories with numbers 1 to 5.

children.title: Act Out Take From With Result Unknown Story Problems To Solve.
children.teaser: Children act out take from with result unknown stories.

children.title: Solve Take From With Result Unknown Story Problems Using Objects From The Story.
children.teaser: Children begin to use objects to solve subtraction stories.

children.title: Represent Take From With Result Unknown Story Problems Using Number Sentences.
children.teaser: Children make subtraction statements.

children.title: Solve Take From With Result Unknown Story Problems With Objects From The Story And Drawings.
children.teaser: Children work with both objects and drawings to solve take from with result unknown problems.

children.title: Create And Solve Subtraction Story Problems By Drawing.
children.teaser: Students have an opportunity to create their own subtraction stories.

children.title: Decontextualizing Addition Stories To Solve Using Fingers, Objects, And Drawings
children.teaser: Students representing the objects in addition story problems to build understanding.

children.title: Solve Addition Story Problems Using Fingers.
children.teaser: Children use their fingers to add.

children.title: Solve Addition Story Problems Using Fingers. (Continued)
children.teaser: Children use their fingers to solve addition story problems.

children.title: Solve Addition Story Problems With Representative Objects.
children.teaser: Children decontextualize using linking cube trains to solve addition problems.

children.title: Solve Addition Story Problems With Representative Drawings.
children.teaser: Students use drawing to represent addition stories.

children.title: Decontextualizing Subtraction Stories To Solve Using Fingers, Objects, And Drawings
children.teaser: Students representing the objects in subtraction story problems to build understanding.

children.title: Solve Subtraction Story Problems Using Fingers.
children.teaser: Children use their fingers to subtract.

children.title: Solve Subtraction Story Problems Using Fingers. (Continued)
children.teaser: Children use their fingers to solve subtraction story problems.

children.title: Solve Subtraction Story Problems With Representative Objects.
children.teaser: Children decontextualize using linking cube trains to solve subtraction problems.

children.title: Solve Subtraction Story Problems With Representative Drawings.
children.teaser: Students use drawing to represent subtraction stories.

children.title: Duplicating And Extending Patterns
children.teaser: Children practice duplicating and extending patterns.

children.title: Identify Patterns Using Objects.
children.teaser: Children use concrete objects to identify a pattern.

children.title: Identify And Duplicate Patterns Using Sounds And Movement. Represent Those Patterns With Objects.
children.teaser: Children identify and duplicate patterns and represent them with objects.

children.title: Duplicate And Extend Patterns With Movement And Objects.
children.teaser: Students identify a repeating pattern, duplicate it, and extend it by predicting the next part.

children.title: Identify A Growth Pattern Using Objects.
children.teaser: Students explore a growth pattern of 2 more.

children.title: Create A Story Problem And Act It Out In The Children's Math Theater.
children.teaser: The Pre-K curriculum culminates with the Children’s Math Theater performance.
